00042 #ifndef PIZ_SEQUENCE_TRANSFORM_H
00043 #define PIZ_SEQUENCE_TRANSFORM_H
00044 
00045 // -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00046 // -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00047 
00048 #include "pizSequence.h"
00049 #include "pizFactorOracle.h"
00050 #include "pizGaloisLattice.h"
00051 #include "pizFiniteState.h"

00056 /**
00057  * \ingroup sequenceTransform
00058  * \ingroup sequenceTypes
00059  */
00060 typedef enum _PIZAlgorithm {
00061     PIZ_ALGORITHM_NONE  = 0,            /*!<  */
00062     PIZ_FACTOR_ORACLE   = 1,            /*!<  */
00063     PIZ_GALOIS_LATTICE  = 2,            /*!<  */
00064     PIZ_FINITE_STATE    = 3             /*!<  */
00065     } PIZAlgorithm;
00066     
00067 // -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00068 // -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00069 
00070 /**
00071  * \brief   Learn from data-mining algorithms.
00072  * \remark  This function is affected by \a chance attribute.
00073  * \param   x A valid pointer.
00074  * \param   select The type of the algorithm as \ref PIZAlgorithm.
00075  * \param   algorithm A valid pointer.
00076  * \return  True if something changed, otherwise false.  
00077  * \ingroup sequenceTransform
00078  */
00079 bool pizSequenceProceedAlgorithm (PIZSequence *x, PIZAlgorithm select, void *algorithm);
00080 
00081 /**
00082  * \brief   Kinda game of life.
00083  * \param   x A valid pointer.
00084  * \param   iterate The number of iterations of the process.
00085  * \return  True if something changed, otherwise false.  
00086  * \ingroup sequenceTransform
00087  */
00088 bool pizSequenceCellularAutomata (PIZSequence *x, long iterate);
00089 
00090 /**
00091  * \brief   Rhythms generator.
00092  * \details The function searches the biggest beat divider (according to the cell) in the list 
00093  *          {2, 3, 4, 5, 7, 11} ; then random distribution tables are used to create/delete notes. 
00094  * \param   x A valid pointer.
00095  * \param   iterate The number of iterations of the process.
00096  * \param   division Force a divider (for example 2 even if 4 match later).
00097  * \return  True if something changed, otherwise false.  
00098  * \ingroup sequenceTransform
00099  */
00100 bool pizSequenceGenerator (PIZSequence *x, long iterate, long division);
00101 
00102 /**
00103  * \brief   Rotate MIDI data between notes in the sequence.
00104  * \param   x A valid pointer.
00105  * \param   selector A selector to set the MIDI data type altered as \ref PIZSelector.
00106  * \param   shift Number of steps to rotate. 
00107  * \return  True if something changed, otherwise false.  
00108  * \ingroup sequenceTransform
00109  */
00110 bool pizSequenceRotate (PIZSequence *x, PIZSelector selector, long shift);
00111 
00112 /**
00113  * \brief   Scramble MIDI data between notes in the sequence.
00114  * \param   x A valid pointer.
00115  * \param   selector A selector to set the MIDI data type altered as \ref PIZSelector.
00116  * \return  True if something changed, otherwise false.  
00117  * \ingroup sequenceTransform
00118  */
00119 bool pizSequenceScramble (PIZSequence *x, PIZSelector selector);
00120 
00121 /**
00122  * \brief   Sort MIDI data in the sequence.
00123  * \param   x A valid pointer.
00124  * \param   selector A selector to set the MIDI data type altered as \ref PIZSelector.
00125  * \param   down Set true if sort down, otherwise up. 
00126  * \return  True if something changed, otherwise false.  
00127  * \ingroup sequenceTransform
00128  */
00129 bool pizSequenceSort (PIZSequence *x, PIZSelector selector, bool down);
00130 
00131 /**
00132  * \brief   Change MIDI data for all notes in the sequence.
00133  * \remark  This function is affected by \a chance attribute.
00134  * \param   x A valid pointer.
00135  * \param   selector A selector to set the MIDI data type altered as \ref PIZSelector.
00136  * \param   value The value to add. 
00137  * \return  True if something changed, otherwise false.  
00138  * \ingroup sequenceTransform
00139  */
00140 bool pizSequenceChange (PIZSequence *x, PIZSelector selector, long value);
00141 
00142 /**
00143  * \brief   Set MIDI data for all notes in the sequence.
00144  * \remark  This function is affected by \a chance attribute.
00145  * \param   x A valid pointer.
00146  * \param   selector A selector to set the MIDI data type altered as \ref PIZSelector.
00147  * \param   value The value to set. 
00148  * \return  True if something changed, otherwise false.  
00149  * \ingroup sequenceTransform
00150  */
00151 bool pizSequenceSet (PIZSequence *x, PIZSelector selector, long value);
00152 
00153 /**
00154  * \brief   Change randomly MIDI data for all notes in the sequence.
00155  * \details The value is drawn at random between provided arguments.
00156  * \remark  This function is affected by \a chance attribute.
00157  * \param   x A valid pointer.
00158  * \param   selector A selector to set the MIDI data type altered as \ref PIZSelector.
00159  * \param   minValue The low border (included). 
00160  * \param   maxValue The high border (included).
00161  * \return  True if something changed, otherwise false.  
00162  * \ingroup sequenceTransform
00163  */
00164 bool pizSequenceRandom (PIZSequence *x, PIZSelector selector, long minValue, long maxValue);
00165 
00166 /**
00167  * \brief   Delete notes in the sequence.
00168  * \remark  This function is affected by \a chance attribute.
00169  * \param   x A valid pointer.
00170  * \return  True if something changed, otherwise false.  
00171  * \ingroup sequenceTransform
00172  */
00173 bool pizSequenceKillNotes (PIZSequence *x);
00174 
00175 /**
00176  * \brief   Transpose according to cycle permutation.
00177  * \details http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cyclic_permutation
00178  * \remark  This function is affected by \a chance attribute.
00179  * \param   x A valid pointer.
00180  * \param   key The tonic.
00181  * \param   a The cycle.
00182  * \return  True if something changed, otherwise false.  
00183  * \ingroup sequenceTransform
00184  */
00185 bool pizSequenceCycle (PIZSequence *x, PIZScaleKey key, const PIZGrowingArray *a);
00186 
00187 /**
00188  * \brief   Fill a private array with PIZNote pointers.
00189  * \param   x A valid pointer.
00190  * \return  The size of the array filled.
00191  * \ingroup sequencePrivate
00192  */
00193 PIZ_LOCAL long pizSequencePickUpNotes (PIZSequence *x);
00194 
00195 /**
00196  * \brief   Fill sequence's notes from a private values array with a private PIZNote pointers array.
00197  * \param   x A valid pointer.
00198  * \param   selector A selector to set the MIDI data type concerned as \ref PIZSelector.
00199  * \param   k The size of arrays.
00200  * \param   reverse Array is traversed in reverse mode if true.
00201  * \ingroup sequencePrivate
00202  */
00203 PIZ_LOCAL void pizSequenceFillValues (PIZSequence *x, PIZSelector selector, long k, bool reverse);
